sentence.Network_en: That was a conjecture, not a fact.
The truth of his conjecture was confirmed by the newspaper report.
sentence.Network_cn: 新闻报道证明了他的推测果然不假。

sentence.Network_en: She didn't know the facts; what she said was pure conjecture.
sentence.Network_cn: 她并不知道实情, 她所说的纯属猜测.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the senses 'to divine' and 'divination'): from Old French, or from Latin conjectura, from conicere 'put together in thought', from con- 'together' + jacere 'throw'

entry.def: A conjecture is a conclusion that is based on information that is not certain or complete.

example.ex: That was a conjecture, not a fact...

entry.def: When you conjecture, you form an opinion or reach a conclusion on the basis of information that is not certain or complete.

example.ex: He conjectured that some individuals may be able to detect major calamities...
example.tran: 他猜测说有些人也许能够察觉重大灾难。

example.ex: This may be true or partly true; we are all conjecturing here.
example.tran: 这可能属实或者部分属实，我们都是在这儿揣测。

means.word_mean: 1. a hypothesis that has been formed by speculating or conjecturing (usually with little hard evidence);

sentences.sentence: "speculations about the outcome of the election"

means.word_mean: 2. a message expressing an opinion based on incomplete evidence
3. reasoning that involves the formation of conclusions from incomplete evidence
1. to believe especially on uncertain or tentative grounds;

sentences.sentence: "Scientists supposed that large dinosaurs lived in swamps"

auth_sentence.content: I had solved the strong Goldbach's conjecture completely.
auth_sentence.res_content: I had solved the strong Goldbach's conjecture completely.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I had solved the strong Goldbach's conjecture completely.

auth_sentence.content: This is the science of conjecture, not empiricism.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is the science of conjecture, not empiricism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is the science of conjecture, not empiricism.

auth_sentence.content: I see nothing but conjecture and anecdotal evidence.
auth_sentence.res_content: I see nothing but conjecture and anecdotal evidence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I see nothing but conjecture and anecdotal evidence.

stems_affixes.word_buile: ab离开+ject抛→抛掉→可怜的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 形容词的,用作形容词的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ad增加+ject投掷,扔+ive……的→扔上去的,附加的
deject[v.使沮丧, 使灰心]+ed表形容词→adj.沮丧的,失望的
object[n.物体;客体,对象;目标;宾语 v.[to]反对]+ive……的→客观的[词性变化:作名词,表示"目标,目的"]
sub在下面+ject投掷,扔→扔下去→服从的,扔下去大家讨论的主题
ad增加+ject投掷,扔+ive……的→扔上去的,附加的
eject[v.投出,掷出]+ion表名词→n.喷出, 排出物
inter在……中间+ject投掷,扔+ion表名词→在句子中间扔出的字→感叹词

stems_affixes.value_cn: 物体;客体,对象;目标;宾语
stems_affixes.word_buile: ob逆,反+ject投掷,扔→反着扔→反对→引申为扔向目标

stems_affixes.value_cn: [to]反对,异议,不喜欢,反对的理由
stems_affixes.word_buile: object反对+ion表名词→n.[to]反对,异议,不喜欢,反对的理由
object[n.物体;客体,对象;目标;宾语 v.[to]反对]+ive……的→客观的[词性变化:作名词,表示"目标,目的"]
pro向前+ject扔→扔向前面→投射;引申为工程项目
project[v.投射出;n.工程项目]+ile物体→向前扔的物体
project[v.投射出;n.工程项目]+ion表名词→n.射出,投射;计划
re回+ject扔回来→拒绝
reject[v.拒绝,抵制,丢弃,排斥,退掉 n.落选者]+ion表名词→n.退回,拒绝
sub在下面+ject投掷,扔→扔下去→服从的,扔下去大家讨论的主题
subject[n.主题;学科 adj.隶属的;易遭..的 v.使隶属]+ion表名词→n.征服
subject主观+ivity表名词→n.主观性, 主观
tra穿+ject投掷,扔+ory范围→扔出去穿过的范围→弹道轨道
con共同+ject投掷,扔+ure表名词→大家一起扔[思想]→推测
de向下+ject投掷,扔→情绪向下扔→沮丧
e出+ject掷→掷出
in进入+ject投掷,扔→扔进去→注射
ob逆,反+ject投掷,扔→反着扔→反对→引申为扔向目标
pro向前+ject扔→扔向前面→投射;引申为工程项目

stems_affixes.value_cn: 拒绝,抵制,丢弃,排斥,退掉
stems_affixes.word_buile: re回+ject扔回来→拒绝

sentences.en: She didn’t know the facts;what she said was pure conjecture.
sentences.cn: 她并不知道实情, 她所说的纯属猜测。

sentences.en: Whether or not her husband knew will always be a matter for conjecture.
sentences.cn: 至于她丈夫知道与否, 将永远是个谜。

means.word_mean: 推测, 猜测, 猜想

sentences.en: The general conjectured that the enemy only had about five days’ supply of food left.
sentences.cn: 将军推测敌人只剩下五天的粮食给养。
